review: This post was sponsored by Revlon as part of a sampling activation for Crowdtap. I received complimentary products to facilitate my review.  To begin, I love this formula. The only reason why I'm not giving it a full  5 stars is because the color I got is literally lighter than my skin right now.  Maybe when I get a few foundation colors lighter by wintertime, I'll actually be able to wear this on its own instead of mixing it with a duskier pink when I contour my lips or do an ombre, but when I wear it right now, my mouth just looks like an unsightly seam covered in too-light concealer. review:
I love the look of my Revlon Super Lustrous Lipstick. The black tube with gold detail is simple and classy - exactly how I think a lipstick should look. I received the shade Black Cherry, which, I have to admit, I wasn't too excited about. I've never been one to wear darker lip shades, and this deep, burgundy shade is one I would usually steer pretty clear from. But, it swatched beautifully on the hand, so I quickly found a mirror and put it on.

This lipstick applies BEAUTIFULLY. It's rich and pigmented and very, very creamy, and went on like a dream. It's soft and moisturizing, and has just the right amount of shine to it, leaving your lips looking full and supple. It may not be a shade I would ever pick for myself, but the formula itself is absolutely fantastic, and has me wanting to try out all the other shades.
I've often had issues with other brand of darker shades like this going on patchy or streaky, which is one of the reasons I tend to stick away from these dark colors, but that is not the case with this lipstick.

I really have to applaud Revlon of this formula, and I can't wait to try more!

review:
This is my favorite lipstick brand of the drugstore variety. And because I am too cheap to buy 30-dollar designer lipsticks, and since the color variety is so great that you're bound to find something to suit you, Revlon's earned my loyalty. I have this in multiple colors - Really Red (Matte), Certainly Red, Kiss Me Coral, Rose Velvet, Teak Rose, Pink in the Afternoon. Kiss Me Coral always gets me tons of compliments - for my fellow fair-skinned ladies, I think it's a very flattering bright coral shade. Rose Velvet and Teak Rose I just purchased - Rose Velvet is a slightly darker shade of my natural lip color, and Teak Rose has a bit more red in it. I think I'll wear a lot of both in the fall. But hands down, Pink in the Afternoon is my absolute favorite. It's the "my lips but better" shade that I wear almost daily, just enough to look polished. I've stocked up on multiple tubes of that shade alone, just in the event they stop making it (please Revlon Gods, don't let that happen!).

While color selection and the creamy formula are great, this lipstick does not have serious staying power, so be prepared for frequent reapplication. Particularly for the darker shades, keep a compact mirror handy in case you start to get the dreaded ring from fading - I drink coffee or water all day, so that's the biggest culprit for me. But still, for the price, it's great overall, and I totally recommend it.

name: darkeyedfran
review:
okay, so first thing is first about these lippies, they come in pearl (which has shimmers), creme, and matte. i've only bought the creme because thats my personal cup of tea! I own Pink In The Afternoon, Love that Pink, Rose Velvet, Demure, Berry Rich, and Coralberry. I read many reviews before buying any of these to see if they would be good for my skintone, I know my lips very well and what will look good on and these don't dissapoint. I know alot of people complain about color but you can't expect for all 72 colors to look good on you. for example, if youre a redhead buying Love that Pink expect to look like a clown.
I have never fallen in love with lipsticks before, i have like 6 or 7 MAC lipsticks that my makeup buddy has given me and I like them I just didnt go crazy over them, some of them are too soft and fall over :( I really only like the luster ones from MAC but they are kind of sheer. That being said Revlon makes better lipsticks for my budget and for my taste! all of the ones I own except for demure are very pigmented :) they are all so nice to apply too! I love love love the texture of these lippies and I love pulling out my sleek black and gold tubes!!! These have a very satisfying click when you close them and they are not so heavy in your purse as MAC lipsticks are. These are between 5ish and 7ish dollars where ive found them and most of the time there are revlon coupons and bogo sales so you really have nothing to lose in trying these out. I've never felt so ladylike and classic until I got these and I love that some of the shades have been around for more than half a century. This has convinced me to never buy an expensive lippie again. If you want to know more about each shade i've reviewed all of the ones I own. Thank you so much Revlon for making such a gem! i always exfoliate my lips at night and in the morning and then i put on a light coat of burts bees while i do my makeup and swipe on my lipstick before i go out the door. These are already very light on the lips (not heavy at all) but I just really like to have balm on. these dont really need it however)
forgot to add that these got VERY low toxicity ratings so they are great for your lips!!!!
